## Portfolio Weight Calculation for Multiple Stocks ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} set.seed(505) #| eval: true #| results: asis #| echo: false #| warning: false library(webexercises) # Randomizing share prices price_abt <- rnorm(1, mean = 60, sd = 8) price_low <- rnorm(1, mean = 40, sd = 3) price_bll <- rnorm(1, mean = 50, sd = 4) # Randomizing number of shares while ensuring total investment is consistent investment <- 20000 shares_abt <- sample(100:300, 1) shares_low <- sample(100:300, 1) remaining_investment <- investment - (shares_abt * price_abt) - (shares_low * price_low) shares_bll <- round(remaining_investment / price_bll) # Compute values value_abt <- shares_abt * price_abt value_low <- shares_low * price_low value_bll <- shares_bll * price_bll total_value <- value_abt + value_low + value_bll # Ensure weights sum to 1 weight_abt <- value_abt / total_value weight_low <- value_low / total_value weight_bll <- value_bll / total_value ``` ::: Suppose you purchase **251** shares of Company A at \$**51.03** per share, **275** shares of Company B at \$**36.15** per share, and **-66** shares of Company C at \$**41.84** per share. ::: {.question-block}
✅ Weight on Company A = value_A / total_value × 100 = **64.08**%.
:::
